newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian bond spreads widen vs dollar bloc.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian bond spreads widen vs dollar bloc.

text.p: Australian bond yield spreads to other dollar bloc bonds reversed an initial tightening trend as the local market corrected its recent steep rally.

A weak U.S. bond market in Tokyo and a sharp fall in the Australian dollar followed comments by Japan's senior Finance Ministry official Eisuke Sakakibara and saw local yields spike up nearly 20 basis points from the 32 month lows seen in afterhours trading on Wednesday.
Sakakibara said that the Japanese economy was stronger than the market thought and the yen's correction should be over, stirring concerns that Japan was about to tighten policy.

U.S. Treasuries had already weakened in New York as the market absorbed a US$10.0 billion 10-year note auction and faces the last leg of the quarterly refunding with the sale of US$10.0 billion of 30-year bonds later today.
Canadian bonds also outpaced the U.S. on Wednesday after what was see as a successful 10-year Canadian bond auction.
Meanwhile, New Zealand bonds weakened roughly in tandem with the local market.
